intro: Amsinckia ampla, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Amsinckia ampla is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
